This is a common problem when using punycode / IDN Domains. It happens if an badly coded application hands over i18n domains that are punycode/IDN encoded. For safety reasons, they encode Domains with urlencoding. those URI are than passed to the browser. the browser tries to do an DNS request but fails because url encoded dns names are not valid.

example:
you want to open the page : http://www.igräte.de/blog/
the application hands over: http://www.iger%c3%a4te.de/blog/

explanation with php example:
It is not a typical Firefox bug, because the URI/URL handling is job of the application or OS, but nowadays also web applications try to emulate desktop apps and fail because they use e.g. PHPs urlencode(); -mostly with web security in mind- but then break IDN support.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. get adium or any other (web)app that uses url encoding for links 
2. click on the link
3. get a message like "Firefox can't find the server at URL with %c3%a4" in it
Actual Results:  
Error message problem loading page

Expected Results:  
getting to the URL you clicked

there are many ways to get to this problem, some web apps (i will file a bug at their bug tracking tools as whell) and programs like Adium (probably pidgin, too) encode links wrongly. i observerd this behavior on Mac OS X so there might be also an OS component within the problem.
